onRecognitionResumed().Description: Called when the recognition is resumed after it was temporarily paused. This is an informational callback, and the clients shouldn't be doing anything here except showing an indication on their UI if they have to.

onError().Description: Called when the detection fails due to an error.

onRecognitionPaused().Description: Called when the recognition is paused temporarily for some reason. This is an informational callback, and the clients shouldn't be doing anything here except showing an indication on their UI if they have to.

Parameters: AlwaysOnHotwordDetector.EventPayload: Payload data for the detection event. This may contain the trigger audio, if requested when calling @B_android#service#voice#AlwaysOnHotwordDetector#startRecognition_E@. This value must never be null.
onDetected(android.service.voice.AlwaysO.Description: Called when the keyphrase is spoken. This implicitly stops listening for the keyphrase once it's detected. Clients should start a recognition again once they are done handling this detection.

onAvailabilityChanged(int).Description: Called when the hotword availability changes. This indicates a change in the availability of recognition for the given keyphrase. It's called at least once with the initial availability. Availability implies whether the hardware on this system is capable of listening for the given keyphrase or not.
